  • India lost the match by 184 runs, trailing 2-1 in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.
  • Jaiswal's dismissal was reviewed via DRS with inconclusive evidence.
  • Khanna emphasized the need for fair play and called the team's performance underwhelming.
  • India's point percentage in the World Test Championship has dropped to 52.78.
  • Australia is close to securing a spot in the WTC final, needing just one win from their upcoming matches.

  • Rishabh Pant's poor shot selection cost India dearly in the final session.

title: Jacob Duffy lands knockout blows to claim 2-0 series lead - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Jacob Duffy lands knockout blows to claim 2-0 series lead

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: ESPN Cricinfo

New Zealand 186 for 5 (Chapman 42, Hay 41, Robinson 41) beat Sri Lanka 141 (Perera 48, Duffy 4-15) by 45 runs.

In a convincing second T20I victory, New Zealand's comprehensive team effort saw them emerge victorious over Sri Lanka, securing a 2-0 series lead.

  • New Zealand set a target of 187 runs for Sri Lanka, who struggled to achieve it, managing only 141 runs.
  • Jacob Duffy's exceptional bowling performance, taking 4 wickets for just 15 runs, played a crucial role in New Zealand's win.
  • Mitchell Hay was named player of the match for his explosive 41 runs off just 19 balls.
  • Sri Lanka's batting woes continued, with their inability to finish innings strongly raising concerns.
  • Key contributors for Sri Lanka included Kusal Perera and Pathum Nissanka, but their efforts were not enough.
  • New Zealand displayed controlled aggression and effective running between the wickets, significantly outpacing Sri Lanka.
“Duffy's 4 for 15 was far and away the best bowling effort, as he provided crucial breakthroughs across Sri Lanka's innings.”

This victory highlights New Zealand's dominance in the series thus far, leaving Sri Lanka searching for answers as they continue to struggle in away conditions.
newTitle: Jacob Duffy Shines as New Zealand Secures 2-0 Lead Against Sri Lanka

Rohit Sharma Calls Poor Form 'Mentally Disturbing' After Australia's Victory in Fourth Test

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

After India's defeat against Australia in the fourth Test, captain Rohit Sharma expressed his disappointment over the team's performance and acknowledged the mental toll it has taken on him.

  • India lost the fourth Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • He described his struggles as a batter, stating that many things are not falling into place and that it is 'mentally disturbing.'
  • Looking forward, Rohit emphasized the importance of playing well in the upcoming match in Sydney to aim for a series draw.
  • He addressed questions about Rishabh Pant's dismissals and the management of Jasprit Bumrah's bowling workload.
  • Rohit praised the performance of Nitish Kumar and recognized the hard work of Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep.
“Obviously, few results have not gone our way and as a captain, it is disappointing. As a batter, a lot of the things I am trying to do are not falling in place. Mentally, look, it is disturbing.”

Rohit's insights reflect the challenges faced by the Indian team and highlight the mental aspects of performance in competitive sports.

title: "Third Umpire Did Make...": On Yashasvi Jaiswal Controversy, Simon Taufel's Blunt Verdict - NDTV Sports
summary:
Yashasvi Jaiswal's Controversial Dismissal: Simon Taufel's Verdict

Date & Source: December 30, 2024 | NDTV Sports

India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal's contentious dismissal sparked a controversy on the final day of the fourth Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Jaiswal was given out caught behind despite no clear edge being shown on the Snicko. The decision was made by third umpire Saikat Sharfuddoula, overturning the on-field umpire's not out call. Jaiswal, batting on 84, argued with the umpires before walking back.

  • Jaiswal was dismissed on 84 after a solid innings of 208 deliveries.
  • The dismissal led to chants of "cheater" around the MCG.
  • The incident follows a similar controversy in the opening Test in Perth involving opener KL Rahul.
"Yeh optical illusion hai." - Sunil Gavaskar questions the third umpire's decision to overrule the Snicko technology.

Former ICC Elite Panel umpire Simon Taufel told Channel 7 that the third umpire made the correct decision to overrule the on-field umpire's not out call based on clear deflection off the bat.

This incident has reignited the debate around the use of technology in making decisions in cricket.
newTitle: Yashasvi Jaiswal's Controversial Dismissal: Simon Taufel's Verdict

The Australian media has targeted Indian captain Rohit Sharma over his frustrated reaction to young teammate Yashasvi Jaiswal dropping three catches during the Boxing Day Test. This follows prior criticism directed at Virat Kohli over a separate incident.

  • The West Australian tabloid labeled Rohit as 'Captain Cry Baby' after he expressed visible frustration with Jaiswal's poor fielding.
  • Rohit's body language was scrutinized by former players, emphasizing the need for support towards younger teammates.
  • Despite Jaiswal usually being a reliable fielder, he faced backlash for the dropped catches, leading to tensions within the team.
“I've got to be honest, I don't like that reaction from the Indian skipper... You don't need to see that as a young player.” — Mike Hussey

This incident highlights the intense pressure on players in high-stakes cricket and the media's role in shaping public perception of athlete behavior.

title: Rohit Sharma to retire from Tests after Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney? Report suggests India captain is trying to… - Mint

summary:
Rohit Sharma Comments on Controversial DRS Dismissal of Yashasvi Jaiswal

Date: December 30, 2024   Source: Live Mint

India captain Rohit Sharma raised concerns about the use of technology in cricket after Yashasvi Jaiswal's controversial dismissal in the fourth Test against Australia, which resulted in India's defeat.

During the match, Jaiswal was given out despite no clear evidence of a contact with the ball, leading to confusion and frustration.

  • Jaiswal was batting on 84 when he was controversially given out.
  • The Indian batting lineup faltered, getting all out for 155 runs.
  • Rohit Sharma expressed his doubts regarding the accuracy of DRS technology.
  • India's loss resulted in a significant setback for their World Test Championship hopes.
“I don't know what to make of (that decision) because the technology didn't show anything but with naked eye it seem that he did touch something,” - Rohit Sharma

In conclusion, the incident has sparked a debate on the reliability of DRS in cricket, particularly in high-stakes matches.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma Comments on Controversial DRS Dismissal of Yashasvi Jaiswal

title: 'Risk of over-bowling Jasprit Bumrah, but he's lacked support': Rohit Sharma after MCG defeat - The Times of India
summary:
Risk of over-bowling Jasprit Bumrah, but he's lacked support: Rohit Sharma after MCG defeat

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date]
Source: Times of India

In a recent press conference, India captain Rohit Sharma expressed his concerns regarding Jasprit Bumrah's heavy bowling workload and the lack of adequate support during the team’s defeat by 184 runs in the fourth Test against Australia.

  • Bumrah took 9 wickets for 156 runs in the match, becoming the fastest Indian bowler to reach 200 Test wickets.
  • Despite Bumrah's outstanding performance, India was unable to secure a victory due to a batting collapse, losing seven wickets for just 34 runs.
  • Rohit acknowledged the risk of over-bowling Bumrah and noted his exhaustion by the end of the match.
  • He praised Bumrah's commitment and selflessness but highlighted the ongoing issue of insufficient support for the star bowler.
“There is a risk of over-bowling Bumrah, but when someone is in form, you tend to bowl him more.” - Rohit Sharma

The team must find ways to better support Bumrah as they prepare for the final Test of the series, scheduled to commence at the Sydney Cricket Ground on January 3.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma Addresses Jasprit Bumrah's Workload After MCG Defeat

title: Nominees for ICC Men’s Test Cricketer of the Year unveiled - ICC Cricket
summary:
Nominees for ICC Men’s Test Cricketer of the Year unveiled

Date: October 2024 | Source: ICC Cricket

The ICC has unveiled the nominees for the Men’s Test Cricketer of the Year, showcasing stellar performances from four elite players throughout 2024.

  • Joe Root (England): 1556 runs from 17 Tests, average 55.57, with six centuries and a standout score of 262 against Pakistan.
  • Jasprit Bumrah (India): 71 wickets from 13 Tests, average 14.92, notable for a five-wicket haul and capturing three wickets in a crucial match against Australia.
  • Kamindu Mendis (Sri Lanka): 1049 runs from nine Tests, average 74.92, remembered for being the joint-third quickest to reach 1000 Test runs.
  • Harry Brook (England): 1100 runs from 12 Tests, average 55.00, highlighted by a remarkable triple century against Pakistan.
“2024 was a remarkable year for all these nominees, showcasing their exceptional talent in international cricket.” - ICC spokesperson

The recognition of these players signifies their contributions to the sport and sets the stage for an exciting awards ceremony.
newTitle: Nominees for ICC Men’s Test Cricketer of the Year unveiled

title: All-time attendance record for a Test in Australia broken at the MCG - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
All-time attendance record for a Test in Australia broken at the MCG

Date: December 2024 Source: Cricket Australia

A new attendance record for a Test match in Australia has been established at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), with over 373,691 spectators attending the fourth Test between Australia and India.

The attendance surpassed the old record of 350,534 set in 1937, with significant crowds throughout the match.

  • Over 373,691 total attendees, breaking a nearly 90-year-old record.
  • First session of the fifth day had 51,371 attendees, culminating in a total of 74,362.
  • Daily attendance figures were 87,242, 85,147, 83,073, 43,867, and 74,362.
  • Parking areas were opened to accommodate the large crowd, causing some delays.
“The crowds have been absolutely extraordinary for this Test match.”

This historic match highlights cricket's popularity in Australia and sets a new benchmark for future events at the MCG.
newTitle: Record Attendance Set at MCG for Test Match

summary:
India vs Australia 4th Test Day 5 Highlights: AUS beat IND by 184 runs

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Australia secured a commanding 184-run victory over India in the 4th Test, taking a 2-1 lead in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Pat Cummins played a pivotal role with both bat and ball, earning the Player of the Match title.

  • India started the day needing 340 runs to win but fell short as Australia took seven wickets in the final session.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal’s solid 84 runs were overshadowed by India’s collapse.
  • Pat Cummins led the Australian bowling attack with three wickets, alongside Scott Boland and Nathan Lyon.
  • India's struggles highlighted ongoing concerns about their top order batting and overall team performance.
  • Rohit Sharma expressed disappointment in failing to capitalize on early chances.
“It is pretty disappointing. It’s not that we went in with the intent of giving up the fight.” - Rohit Sharma

This match emphasized Australia's resilience and strategic prowess, as they now need only a draw in the final Test to clinch the series.

title: WATCH | Travis Head unrolls new celebration after Rishabh Pant wicket, netizens ask ’What’s this about?’ - Mint
summary:
Travis Head's Unique Celebration After Dismissing Rishabh Pant Sparks Confusion and Speculation

Date: December 30, 2024, Source: cricket.com.au

After causing headaches for the Indian team with his batting, Travis Head now has the Indian batsmen scratching their heads with his spin bowling and unique celebrations. Head dismissed Rishabh Pant on the 5th day of the 4th Test, leaving the cricketing world puzzled by his celebratory gesture.

  • Travis Head was brought in to bowl by skipper Pat Cummins, tempting Yashasvi Jaiswal or Rishabh Pant to play big shots.
  • Head's tactic worked, and Pant fell for it, playing a big shot off him and getting out on 30.
  • Head celebrated Pant's wicket with a unique hand gesture that confused many, including cricket fans and players.
  • Team India lost wickets quickly after Pant's dismissal and eventually lost the match by over 184 runs, leaving the Border Gavaskar Trophy series out of their reach.

“Why is he showing to Australian players!!” wrote one user

“What does that sign means. What is Travis Head doing?” wrote another user

Conclusion: While Head's celebration may have been a fun moment for cricket fans, it also highlighted the intense pressure and competition between the Indian and Australian teams during the Test match.
newTitle: Travis Head's Unique Celebration After Dismissing Rishabh Pant Sparks Confusion and Speculation
